context: Act 2B Chapter 2.3 — Building territory through racing. Control districts, earn loyalty. Power and responsibility.

lines.text: Three months. Twelve victories. Four districts.

You have done what no driver in Nova Pacifica's underground history has done — won the crown in every circuit. Downtown. Harbor. Industrial. Hillside. Four territories. Four crews who now look to you not just as a racer, but as a leader.

Maya's garage has become the unofficial headquarters of the underground. Cars line the street outside. Drivers come for tuning advice. Crew leaders come for dispute resolution. You settle arguments about race rules at 3 AM and approve new circuits at dawn.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: You know, when I agreed to be your mechanic, I didn't sign up for running a government.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: There's a guy from the Salts waiting to talk about fishing boat access for the Dock Run. And Ironworks wants to expand their circuit past the old refinery. And someone — I don't even know who — left a goat in the shop as a gift.

choices.text: I never asked for this. I just wanted to race.
This is bigger than racing now. We're building something.
The goat stays. I like the goat.

lines.label: maya_truth
lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: Nobody who changes things ever asks for it. They just do what needs doing and one day they look up and realize the world rearranged itself around them.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: But here's the thing — the underground needs leadership or it becomes chaos. You're not just a racer anymore. You're a symbol. People need symbols.

lines.label: diesel_warning
lines.text: The shop door opens. Diesel walks in, grease on his hands, disapproval on his face.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Building something. I've heard that before. From every underground king who started believing their own legend.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: The underground isn't an empire. The moment it becomes one, it stops being the underground and starts being just another power structure. And power structures attract the wrong kind of attention.

lines.label: maya_laughs
lines.text: Maya laughs. A real laugh — the kind that surprises her, that breaks through the exhaustion and the grease stains and the impossibility of managing a underground racing network out of a two-bay garage.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: The goat is named Fernando and he eats everything including brake lines. He does NOT stay.

lines.label: diesel_arrives
lines.text: Diesel walks through the bay door. He has seen the evolution of the garage from shop to headquarters. His expression is complicated — proud and worried in equal measure.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: We need to talk. All three of us.

lines.label: territory_meeting
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: I've been hearing things. The Hillside Runners are unhappy. They think their territory is being absorbed, not represented. And the Salts want more autonomy — Koa is talking about splitting from the unified schedule.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: There's also money to deal with. The prize pools have tripled since the international event. Someone needs to manage the funds, set up entry fees, handle disputes. That used to be crew-by-crew. Now it's—

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: Now it's you.

choices.text: Set up a council. One rep from each crew. Decisions by vote.
I'll handle it personally. People trust me, not a committee.
Let each crew keep their autonomy. I'm a coordinator, not a king.

lines.label: democratic_path
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: A council. That's — yeah. That's the right call. Power shared is power sustained.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: I'll set up the meetings. Neutral ground — the old warehouse by the waterfront. One table, four chairs, no weapons, no posturing.

lines.label: autocratic_path
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: That's how it starts. Personal control. 'I can handle it.' And then one day you wake up and you're the thing you were racing against.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: I'll support you. But Diesel's right — be careful. The line between leader and tyrant is thinner than you think.

lines.label: federated_path
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Coordinator. Not king. I like the sound of that. Reminds me of how it used to be.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: It means more work for you — mediating, traveling between crews, being everywhere at once. But it respects what the underground is.

lines.label: empire_future
lines.text: That night, you drive through all four districts. Downtown, where it started. Harbor, where the Salts race against the tide. Industrial, where sparks fly from the foundry and the asphalt. Hillside, where the mountain decides who lives and who learns.
This is yours. Not because you took it — because you earned it. Corner by corner, race by race, respect by respect.
But empires attract attention. And somewhere in the federal building downtown, a task force is meeting. And somewhere in the shadows, Zero is watching your empire grow.
They are both hungry. And empires are exactly what they eat.
